metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19935 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ext/imap/php_imap.c in PHP 5.x and 7.x before 7.3.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via an empty string in the message argument to the imap_mail function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

php5-imap - 5.4.6-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php5 in precise and trusty doesn't build imap, it is in a separate php-imap source package.

criterions.comment: php-imap package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.6-0ubuntu5.1').
